trans-unit.source: Things you must do for any network-enabled app.
trans-unit.target: Things you must do for any network-enabled app.

trans-unit.source: Networking basics
trans-unit.target: Networking basics

trans-unit.source: Networking basics
trans-unit.target: Networking basics

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Things you must do for any network-enabled app.
trans-unit.target: Things you must do for any network-enabled app.

trans-unit.source: Capabilities
trans-unit.target: Capabilities

trans-unit.source: In order to use networking, you must add appropriate capability elements to your app manifest.
trans-unit.target: In order to use networking, you must add appropriate capability elements to your app manifest.

trans-unit.source: If no network capability is specified in your app's manifest, your app will have no networking capability, and any attempt to connect to the network will fail.
trans-unit.target: If no network capability is specified in your app's manifest, your app will have no networking capability, and any attempt to connect to the network will fail.

trans-unit.source: The following are the most-used networking capabilities.
trans-unit.target: The following are the most-used networking capabilities.

trans-unit.source: Capability
trans-unit.target: Capability

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: internetClient
trans-unit.target: internetClient

trans-unit.source: Provides outbound access to the Internet and networks in public places, like airports and coffee shop.
trans-unit.target: Provides outbound access to the Internet and networks in public places, like airports and coffee shop.

trans-unit.source: Most apps that require Internet access should use this capability.
trans-unit.target: Most apps that require Internet access should use this capability.

trans-unit.source: internetClientServer
trans-unit.target: internetClientServer

trans-unit.source: Gives the app inbound and outbound network access from the Internet and networks in public places like airports and coffee shops.
trans-unit.target: Gives the app inbound and outbound network access from the Internet and networks in public places like airports and coffee shops.

trans-unit.source: privateNetworkClientServer
trans-unit.target: privateNetworkClientServer

trans-unit.source: Gives the app inbound and outbound network access at the user's trusted places, like home and work.
trans-unit.target: Gives the app inbound and outbound network access at the user's trusted places, like home and work.

trans-unit.source: There are other capabilities that might be necessary for your app, in certain circumstances.
trans-unit.target: There are other capabilities that might be necessary for your app, in certain circumstances.

trans-unit.source: Capability
trans-unit.target: Capability

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: pushNotifications
trans-unit.target: pushNotifications

trans-unit.source: If your app uses socket activity triggers, you must specify this capability in the app manifest.
trans-unit.target: If your app uses socket activity triggers, you must specify this capability in the app manifest.

trans-unit.source: enterpriseAuthentication
trans-unit.target: enterpriseAuthentication

trans-unit.source: Allows an app to connect to network resources that require domain credentials.
trans-unit.target: Allows an app to connect to network resources that require domain credentials.

trans-unit.source: This capability will require a domain administrator to enable the functionality for all apps.
trans-unit.target: This capability will require a domain administrator to enable the functionality for all apps.

trans-unit.source: An example would be an app that retrieves data from SharePoint servers on a private Intranet.
trans-unit.target: An example would be an app that retrieves data from SharePoint servers on a private Intranet.

trans-unit.source: With this capability your credentials can be used to access network resources on a network that requires credentials.
trans-unit.target: With this capability your credentials can be used to access network resources on a network that requires credentials.

trans-unit.source: An app with this capability can impersonate you on the network.
trans-unit.target: An app with this capability can impersonate you on the network.

trans-unit.source: This capability is not required to allow an app to access the Internet via an authenticating proxy.
trans-unit.target: This capability is not required to allow an app to access the Internet via an authenticating proxy.

trans-unit.source: proximity
trans-unit.target: proximity

trans-unit.source: Required for near-field proximity communication with devices in close proximity to the computer.
trans-unit.target: Required for near-field proximity communication with devices in close proximity to the computer.

trans-unit.source: Near-field proximity may be used to send or connect with an application on a nearby device.
trans-unit.target: Near-field proximity may be used to send or connect with an application on a nearby device.

trans-unit.source: This capability allows an app to access the network to connect to a device in close proximity, with user consent to send an invite or accept an invite.
trans-unit.target: This capability allows an app to access the network to connect to a device in close proximity, with user consent to send an invite or accept an invite.

trans-unit.source: sharedUserCertificates
trans-unit.target: sharedUserCertificates

trans-unit.source: This capability allows an app to access software and hardware certificates, such as smart card certificates.
trans-unit.target: This capability allows an app to access software and hardware certificates, such as smart card certificates.

trans-unit.source: When this capability is invoked at runtime, the user must take action, such as inserting a card or selecting a certificate.
trans-unit.target: When this capability is invoked at runtime, the user must take action, such as inserting a card or selecting a certificate.

trans-unit.source: With this capability, your software and hardware certificates or a smart card are used for identification in the app.
trans-unit.target: With this capability, your software and hardware certificates or a smart card are used for identification in the app.

trans-unit.source: This capability may be used by your employer, bank, or government services for identification.
trans-unit.target: This capability may be used by your employer, bank, or government services for identification.

trans-unit.source: Communicating when your app is not in the foreground
trans-unit.target: Communicating when your app is not in the foreground

trans-unit.source: [Support your app with background tasks](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt299103) contains general information about using background tasks to do work when your app is not in the foreground.
trans-unit.target: [Support your app with background tasks](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt299103) contains general information about using background tasks to do work when your app is not in the foreground.

trans-unit.source: More specifically, your code must take special steps to be notified when it is not the current foreground app and data arrives over the network for it.
trans-unit.target: More specifically, your code must take special steps to be notified when it is not the current foreground app and data arrives over the network for it.

trans-unit.source: You used Control Channel Triggers for this purpose in Windows 8, and they are still supported in Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: You used Control Channel Triggers for this purpose in Windows 8, and they are still supported in Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Full information about using Control Channel Triggers is available [**here**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).
trans-unit.target: Full information about using Control Channel Triggers is available [**here**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).

trans-unit.source: A new technology in Windows 10 provides better functionality with lower overhead for some scenarios, such as push-enabled stream sockets: the socket broker and socket activity triggers.
trans-unit.target: A new technology in Windows 10 provides better functionality with lower overhead for some scenarios, such as push-enabled stream sockets: the socket broker and socket activity triggers.

trans-unit.source: If your app uses [**DatagramSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241319), [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882), or [**StreamSocketListener**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226906), then your app can transfer ownership of an open socket to a socket broker provided by the system, and then leave the foreground, or even terminate.
trans-unit.target: If your app uses [**DatagramSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241319), [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882), or [**StreamSocketListener**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226906), then your app can transfer ownership of an open socket to a socket broker provided by the system, and then leave the foreground, or even terminate.

trans-unit.source: When a connection is made on the transferred socket, or traffic arrives on that socket, then your app or its designated background task are activated.
trans-unit.target: When a connection is made on the transferred socket, or traffic arrives on that socket, then your app or its designated background task are activated.

trans-unit.source: If your app is not running, it is started.
trans-unit.target: If your app is not running, it is started.

trans-unit.source: The socket broker then notifies your app using a [**SocketActivityTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806009) that new traffic has arrived.
trans-unit.target: The socket broker then notifies your app using a [**SocketActivityTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806009) that new traffic has arrived.

trans-unit.source: Your app reclaims the socket from the socket broker and process the traffic on the socket.
trans-unit.target: Your app reclaims the socket from the socket broker and process the traffic on the socket.

trans-unit.source: This means that your app consumes far less system resources when it is not actively processing network traffic.
trans-unit.target: This means that your app consumes far less system resources when it is not actively processing network traffic.

trans-unit.source: The socket broker is intended to replace Control Channel Triggers where it is applicable, because it provides the same functionality, but with fewer restrictions and a smaller memory footprint.
trans-unit.target: The socket broker is intended to replace Control Channel Triggers where it is applicable, because it provides the same functionality, but with fewer restrictions and a smaller memory footprint.

trans-unit.source: Socket broker can be used by apps that are not lock screen apps, and it is used the same way on phones as on other devices.
trans-unit.target: Socket broker can be used by apps that are not lock screen apps, and it is used the same way on phones as on other devices.

trans-unit.source: Apps need not be running when traffic arrives in order to be activated by the socket broker.
trans-unit.target: Apps need not be running when traffic arrives in order to be activated by the socket broker.

trans-unit.source: And the socket broker supports listening on TCP sockets, which Control Channel Triggers do not support.
trans-unit.target: And the socket broker supports listening on TCP sockets, which Control Channel Triggers do not support.

trans-unit.source: If your app uses socket activity triggers, you must specify the **pushNotifications** capability in the app manifest.
trans-unit.target: If your app uses socket activity triggers, you must specify the **pushNotifications** capability in the app manifest.

trans-unit.source: Choosing a network trigger
trans-unit.target: Choosing a network trigger

trans-unit.source: There are some scenarios where either kind of trigger would be suitable.
trans-unit.target: There are some scenarios where either kind of trigger would be suitable.

trans-unit.source: When you are choosing which kind of trigger to use in your app, consider the following advice.
trans-unit.target: When you are choosing which kind of trigger to use in your app, consider the following advice.

trans-unit.source: If you are using [**IXMLHTTPRequest2**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831151), [**System.Net.Http.HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) or [System.Net.Http.HttpClientHandler](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241638), you must use [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).
trans-unit.target: If you are using [**IXMLHTTPRequest2**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831151), [**System.Net.Http.HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) or [System.Net.Http.HttpClientHandler](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241638), you must use [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).

trans-unit.source: If you are using push-enabled **StreamSockets**, you can use control channel triggers, but should prefer [**SocketActivityTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806009).
trans-unit.target: If you are using push-enabled **StreamSockets**, you can use control channel triggers, but should prefer [**SocketActivityTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806009).

trans-unit.source: The latter choice allows the system to free up memory and reduce power requirements when the connection is not being actively used.
trans-unit.target: The latter choice allows the system to free up memory and reduce power requirements when the connection is not being actively used.

trans-unit.source: If you want to minimize the memory footprint of your app when it is not actively servicing network requests, prefer [**SocketActivityTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806009) when possible.
trans-unit.target: If you want to minimize the memory footprint of your app when it is not actively servicing network requests, prefer [**SocketActivityTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806009) when possible.

trans-unit.source: If you want your app to be able to receive data while the system is in Connected Standby mode, use [**SocketActivityTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806009).
trans-unit.target: If you want your app to be able to receive data while the system is in Connected Standby mode, use [**SocketActivityTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806009).

trans-unit.source: For details and examples of how to use the socket broker, see [Network communications in the background](network-communications-in-the-background.md).
trans-unit.target: For details and examples of how to use the socket broker, see [Network communications in the background](network-communications-in-the-background.md).

trans-unit.source: Secured connections
trans-unit.target: Secured connections

trans-unit.source: Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and the more recent Transport Layer Security (TLS) are cryptographic protocols designed to provide authentication and encryption for network communication.
trans-unit.target: Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and the more recent Transport Layer Security (TLS) are cryptographic protocols designed to provide authentication and encryption for network communication.

trans-unit.source: These protocols are designed to prevent eavesdropping and tampering when sending and receiving network data.
trans-unit.target: These protocols are designed to prevent eavesdropping and tampering when sending and receiving network data.

trans-unit.source: These protocols use a client-server model for the protocol exchanges.
trans-unit.target: These protocols use a client-server model for the protocol exchanges.

trans-unit.source: These protocols also use digital certificates and certificate authorities to verify that the server is who it claims to be.
trans-unit.target: These protocols also use digital certificates and certificate authorities to verify that the server is who it claims to be.

trans-unit.source: Creating secure socket connections
trans-unit.target: Creating secure socket connections

trans-unit.source: A [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) object can be configured to use SSL/TLS for communications between the client and the server.
trans-unit.target: A [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) object can be configured to use SSL/TLS for communications between the client and the server.

trans-unit.source: This support for SSL/TLS is limited to using the **StreamSocket** object as the client in the SSL/TLS negotiation.
trans-unit.target: This support for SSL/TLS is limited to using the **StreamSocket** object as the client in the SSL/TLS negotiation.

trans-unit.source: You cannot use SSL/TLS with the **StreamSocket** created by a [**StreamSocketListener**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226906) when incoming communications are received, because SSL/TLS negotiation as a server is not implemented by the **StreamSocket** class.
trans-unit.target: You cannot use SSL/TLS with the **StreamSocket** created by a [**StreamSocketListener**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226906) when incoming communications are received, because SSL/TLS negotiation as a server is not implemented by the **StreamSocket** class.

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to secure a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) connection with SSL/TLS:
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to secure a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) connection with SSL/TLS:

trans-unit.source: [**ConnectAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701504) - Make the initial connection to a network service and negotiate immediately to use SSL/TLS for all communications.
trans-unit.target: [**ConnectAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701504) - Make the initial connection to a network service and negotiate immediately to use SSL/TLS for all communications.

trans-unit.source: [**UpgradeToSslAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226922) - Connect initially to a network service without encryption.
trans-unit.target: [**UpgradeToSslAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226922) - Connect initially to a network service without encryption.

trans-unit.source: The app may send or receive data.
trans-unit.target: The app may send or receive data.

trans-unit.source: Then, upgrade the connection to use SSL/TLS for all further communications.
trans-unit.target: Then, upgrade the connection to use SSL/TLS for all further communications.

trans-unit.source: The SocketProtectionLevel value that you provide sets the minimum protection level you are willing to allow.
trans-unit.target: The SocketProtectionLevel value that you provide sets the minimum protection level you are willing to allow.

trans-unit.source: However, the eventual protection level of the established connection is determined in a negotiation process between both endpoints of the connection.
trans-unit.target: However, the eventual protection level of the established connection is determined in a negotiation process between both endpoints of the connection.

trans-unit.source: The result can be a more-secure protection level than the one you specified, if the other endpoint requires a higher level.
trans-unit.target: The result can be a more-secure protection level than the one you specified, if the other endpoint requires a higher level.

trans-unit.source: The SSL strength actually negotiated using [**ConnectAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701504) or [**UpgradeToSslAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226922) can be determined by getting the [**StreamSocketinformation.ProtectionLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh967868) property after the async operation has completed successfully.
trans-unit.target: The SSL strength actually negotiated using [**ConnectAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701504) or [**UpgradeToSslAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226922) can be determined by getting the [**StreamSocketinformation.ProtectionLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh967868) property after the async operation has completed successfully.

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: Your code should never implicitly depend on using a particular protection level, or on the assumption that a given security level is used by default.
trans-unit.target: Your code should never implicitly depend on using a particular protection level, or on the assumption that a given security level is used by default.

trans-unit.source: The security landscape changes constantly, and protocols and default protection levels will be changed over time in order to avoid the use of protocols with known weaknesses.
trans-unit.target: The security landscape changes constantly, and protocols and default protection levels will be changed over time in order to avoid the use of protocols with known weaknesses.

trans-unit.source: Defaults can vary depending on individual machine configuration, or on which software is installed and which patches have been applied.
trans-unit.target: Defaults can vary depending on individual machine configuration, or on which software is installed and which patches have been applied.

trans-unit.source: If your app depends on the use of a particular security level, you must explicitly specify that level and then check to be sure that it is actually in use on the established connection.
trans-unit.target: If your app depends on the use of a particular security level, you must explicitly specify that level and then check to be sure that it is actually in use on the established connection.

trans-unit.source: Use ConnectAsync
trans-unit.target: Use ConnectAsync

trans-unit.source: [**ConnectAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701504) can be used to establish the initial connection with a network service and then negotiate immediately to use SSL/TLS for all communications.
trans-unit.target: [**ConnectAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701504) can be used to establish the initial connection with a network service and then negotiate immediately to use SSL/TLS for all communications.

trans-unit.source: There are two **ConnectAsync** methods that support passing a *protectionLevel* parameter:
trans-unit.target: There are two **ConnectAsync** methods that support passing a *protectionLevel* parameter:

trans-unit.source: [**ConnectAsync(EndpointPair, SocketProtectionLevel)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701511) - Starts an asynchronous operation on a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) object to connect to a remote network destination specified as an [**EndpointPair**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700953) object and a [**SocketProtectionLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226880).
trans-unit.target: [**ConnectAsync(EndpointPair, SocketProtectionLevel)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701511) - Starts an asynchronous operation on a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) object to connect to a remote network destination specified as an [**EndpointPair**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700953) object and a [**SocketProtectionLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226880).

trans-unit.source: [**ConnectAsync(HostName, String, SocketProtectionLevel)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226916) - Starts an asynchronous operation on a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) object to connect to a remote destination specified by a remote hostname, a remote service name, and a [**SocketProtectionLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226880).
trans-unit.target: [**ConnectAsync(HostName, String, SocketProtectionLevel)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226916) - Starts an asynchronous operation on a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) object to connect to a remote destination specified by a remote hostname, a remote service name, and a [**SocketProtectionLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226880).

trans-unit.source: If the *protectionLevel* parameter is set to **Windows.Networking.Sockets.SocketProtectionLevel.Ssl** when calling either of the above [**ConnectAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701504) methods, the [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) must will be established to use SSL/TLS for encryption.
trans-unit.target: If the *protectionLevel* parameter is set to **Windows.Networking.Sockets.SocketProtectionLevel.Ssl** when calling either of the above [**ConnectAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701504) methods, the [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) must will be established to use SSL/TLS for encryption.

trans-unit.source: This value requires encryption and never allows a NULL cipher to be used.
trans-unit.target: This value requires encryption and never allows a NULL cipher to be used.

trans-unit.source: The normal sequence to use with one of these [**ConnectAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701504) methods is the same.
trans-unit.target: The normal sequence to use with one of these [**ConnectAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701504) methods is the same.

trans-unit.source: Create a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882).
trans-unit.target: Create a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882).

trans-unit.source: If an advanced option on the socket is needed, use the [**StreamSocket.Control**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226917) property to get the [**StreamSocketControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226893) instance associated with a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) object.
trans-unit.target: If an advanced option on the socket is needed, use the [**StreamSocket.Control**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226917) property to get the [**StreamSocketControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226893) instance associated with a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) object.

trans-unit.source: Set a property on the **StreamSocketControl**.
trans-unit.target: Set a property on the **StreamSocketControl**.

trans-unit.source: Call one of the above [**ConnectAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701504) methods to start an operation to connect to a remote destination and immediately negotiate the use of SSL/TLS.
trans-unit.target: Call one of the above [**ConnectAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701504) methods to start an operation to connect to a remote destination and immediately negotiate the use of SSL/TLS.

trans-unit.source: The SSL strength actually negotiated using [**ConnectAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701504) can be determined by getting the [**StreamSocketinformation.ProtectionLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh967868) property after the async operation has completed successfully.
trans-unit.target: The SSL strength actually negotiated using [**ConnectAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701504) can be determined by getting the [**StreamSocketinformation.ProtectionLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh967868) property after the async operation has completed successfully.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) and tries to establish a connection to the network service and negotiate immediately to use SSL/TLS.
trans-unit.target: The following example creates a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) and tries to establish a connection to the network service and negotiate immediately to use SSL/TLS.

trans-unit.source: If the negotiation is successful, all network communication using the **StreamSocket** between the client the network server will be encrypted.
trans-unit.target: If the negotiation is successful, all network communication using the **StreamSocket** between the client the network server will be encrypted.

trans-unit.source: Use UpgradeToSslAsync
trans-unit.target: Use UpgradeToSslAsync

trans-unit.source: When your code uses [**UpgradeToSslAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226922), it first establishes a connection to a network service without encryption.
trans-unit.target: When your code uses [**UpgradeToSslAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226922), it first establishes a connection to a network service without encryption.

trans-unit.source: The app may send or receive some data, then upgrade the connection to use SSL/TLS for all further communications.
trans-unit.target: The app may send or receive some data, then upgrade the connection to use SSL/TLS for all further communications.

trans-unit.source: The [**UpgradeToSslAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226922) method takes two parameters.
trans-unit.target: The [**UpgradeToSslAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226922) method takes two parameters.

trans-unit.source: The *protectionLevel* parameter indicates the protection level desired.
trans-unit.target: The *protectionLevel* parameter indicates the protection level desired.

trans-unit.source: The *validationHostName* parameter is the hostname of the remote network destination that is used for validation when upgrading to SSL.
trans-unit.target: The *validationHostName* parameter is the hostname of the remote network destination that is used for validation when upgrading to SSL.

trans-unit.source: Normally the *validationHostName* would be the same hostname that the app used to initially establish the connection.
trans-unit.target: Normally the *validationHostName* would be the same hostname that the app used to initially establish the connection.

trans-unit.source: If the *protectionLevel* parameter is set to **Windows.System.Socket.SocketProtectionLevel.Ssl** when calling **UpgradeToSslAsync**, the [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) must use the SSL/TLS for encryption on further communications over the socket.
trans-unit.target: If the *protectionLevel* parameter is set to **Windows.System.Socket.SocketProtectionLevel.Ssl** when calling **UpgradeToSslAsync**, the [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) must use the SSL/TLS for encryption on further communications over the socket.

trans-unit.source: This value requires encryption and never allows a NULL cipher to be used.
trans-unit.target: This value requires encryption and never allows a NULL cipher to be used.

trans-unit.source: The normal sequence to use with the [**UpgradeToSslAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226922) method is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The normal sequence to use with the [**UpgradeToSslAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226922) method is as follows:

trans-unit.source: Create a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882).
trans-unit.target: Create a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882).

trans-unit.source: If an advanced option on the socket is needed, use the [**StreamSocket.Control**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226917) property to get the [**StreamSocketControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226893) instance associated with a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) object.
trans-unit.target: If an advanced option on the socket is needed, use the [**StreamSocket.Control**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226917) property to get the [**StreamSocketControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226893) instance associated with a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) object.

trans-unit.source: Set a property on the **StreamSocketControl**.
trans-unit.target: Set a property on the **StreamSocketControl**.

trans-unit.source: If any data needs to be sent and received unencrypted, send it now.
trans-unit.target: If any data needs to be sent and received unencrypted, send it now.

trans-unit.source: Call the [**UpgradeToSslAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226922) method to start an operation to upgrade the connection to use SSL/TLS.
trans-unit.target: Call the [**UpgradeToSslAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226922) method to start an operation to upgrade the connection to use SSL/TLS.

trans-unit.source: The SSL strength actually negotiated using [**UpgradeToSslAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226922) can be determined by getting the [**StreamSocketinformation.ProtectionLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh967868) property after the async operation completes successfully.
trans-unit.target: The SSL strength actually negotiated using [**UpgradeToSslAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226922) can be determined by getting the [**StreamSocketinformation.ProtectionLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh967868) property after the async operation completes successfully.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882), tries to establish a connection to the network service, sends some initial data, and then negotiates to use SSL/TLS.
trans-unit.target: The following example creates a [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882), tries to establish a connection to the network service, sends some initial data, and then negotiates to use SSL/TLS.

trans-unit.source: If the negotiation is successful, all network communication using the **StreamSocket** between the client and the network server will be encrypted.
trans-unit.target: If the negotiation is successful, all network communication using the **StreamSocket** between the client and the network server will be encrypted.

trans-unit.source: Creating secure WebSocket connections
trans-unit.target: Creating secure WebSocket connections

trans-unit.source: Like traditional socket connections, WebSocket connections can also be encrypted with Transport Layer Security (TLS)/Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) when using the [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) and [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) features in Windows 8 for a Windows Store app.
trans-unit.target: Like traditional socket connections, WebSocket connections can also be encrypted with Transport Layer Security (TLS)/Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) when using the [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) and [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) features in Windows 8 for a Windows Store app.

trans-unit.source: In most cases you'll want to use a secure WebSocket connection.
trans-unit.target: In most cases you'll want to use a secure WebSocket connection.

trans-unit.source: This will increase the chances that your connection will succeed, as many proxies will reject unencrypted WebSocket connections.
trans-unit.target: This will increase the chances that your connection will succeed, as many proxies will reject unencrypted WebSocket connections.

trans-unit.source: For examples of how to create, or upgrade to, a secure socket connection to a network service, see [How to secure WebSocket connections with TLS/SSL](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh994399).
trans-unit.target: For examples of how to create, or upgrade to, a secure socket connection to a network service, see [How to secure WebSocket connections with TLS/SSL](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh994399).

trans-unit.source: In addition to TLS/SSL encryption, a server may require a **Sec-WebSocket-Protocol** header value to complete the initial handshake.
trans-unit.target: In addition to TLS/SSL encryption, a server may require a **Sec-WebSocket-Protocol** header value to complete the initial handshake.

trans-unit.source: This value, represented by the [**StreamWebSocketInformation.Protocol**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701514) and [**MessageWebSocketInformation.Protocol**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701358) properties, indicate the protocol version of the connection and enables the server to correctly interpret the opening handshake and the data being exchanged afterwards.
trans-unit.target: This value, represented by the [**StreamWebSocketInformation.Protocol**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701514) and [**MessageWebSocketInformation.Protocol**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701358) properties, indicate the protocol version of the connection and enables the server to correctly interpret the opening handshake and the data being exchanged afterwards.

trans-unit.source: Using this protocol information, if at any point if the server cannot interpret the incoming data in a safe manner the connection can be closed.
trans-unit.target: Using this protocol information, if at any point if the server cannot interpret the incoming data in a safe manner the connection can be closed.

trans-unit.source: If the initial request from the client either does not contain this value, or provides a value that doesn't match what the server expects, the expected value is sent from the server to the client on WebSocket handshake error.
trans-unit.target: If the initial request from the client either does not contain this value, or provides a value that doesn't match what the server expects, the expected value is sent from the server to the client on WebSocket handshake error.

trans-unit.source: Authentication
trans-unit.target: Authentication

trans-unit.source: How to provide authentication credentials when connecting over the network.
trans-unit.target: How to provide authentication credentials when connecting over the network.

trans-unit.source: Providing a client certificate with the StreamSocket class
trans-unit.target: Providing a client certificate with the StreamSocket class

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Networking.StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) class supports using SSL/TLS to authenticate the server the app is talking to.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Networking.StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) class supports using SSL/TLS to authenticate the server the app is talking to.

trans-unit.source: In certain cases, the app also needs to authenticate itself to the server using a TLS client certificate.
trans-unit.target: In certain cases, the app also needs to authenticate itself to the server using a TLS client certificate.

trans-unit.source: In Windows 10, you can provide a client certificate on the [**StreamSocket.Control**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226893) object (this must be set before the TLS handshake is started).
trans-unit.target: In Windows 10, you can provide a client certificate on the [**StreamSocket.Control**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226893) object (this must be set before the TLS handshake is started).

trans-unit.source: If the server requests the client certificate, Windows will respond with the certificate provided.
trans-unit.target: If the server requests the client certificate, Windows will respond with the certificate provided.

trans-unit.source: Here is a code snippet showing how to implement this:
trans-unit.target: Here is a code snippet showing how to implement this:

trans-unit.source: Providing authentication credentials to a web service
trans-unit.target: Providing authentication credentials to a web service

trans-unit.source: The networking APIs that enable apps to interact with secure web services each provide their own methods to either initialize a client or set a request header with server and proxy authentication credentials.
trans-unit.target: The networking APIs that enable apps to interact with secure web services each provide their own methods to either initialize a client or set a request header with server and proxy authentication credentials.

trans-unit.source: Each method is set with a [**PasswordCredential**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227061) object that indicates a user name, password, and the resource for which these credentials are used.
trans-unit.target: Each method is set with a [**PasswordCredential**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227061) object that indicates a user name, password, and the resource for which these credentials are used.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides a mapping of these APIs:
trans-unit.target: The following table provides a mapping of these APIs:

trans-unit.source: Handling network exceptions
trans-unit.target: Handling network exceptions

trans-unit.source: In most areas of programming, an exception indicates a significant problem or failure, caused by some flaw in the program.
trans-unit.target: In most areas of programming, an exception indicates a significant problem or failure, caused by some flaw in the program.

trans-unit.source: In network programming, there is an additional source for exceptions: the network itself, and the nature of network communications.
trans-unit.target: In network programming, there is an additional source for exceptions: the network itself, and the nature of network communications.

trans-unit.source: Network communications are inherently unreliable and prone to unexpected failure.
trans-unit.target: Network communications are inherently unreliable and prone to unexpected failure.

trans-unit.source: For each of the ways your app uses networking, you must maintain some state information; and your app code must handle network exceptions by updating that state information and initiating appropriate logic for your app to re-establish or retry communication failures.
trans-unit.target: For each of the ways your app uses networking, you must maintain some state information; and your app code must handle network exceptions by updating that state information and initiating appropriate logic for your app to re-establish or retry communication failures.

trans-unit.source: When Universal Windows apps throw an exception, your exception handler can retrieve more detailed information on the cause of the exception to better understand the failure and make appropriate decisions.
trans-unit.target: When Universal Windows apps throw an exception, your exception handler can retrieve more detailed information on the cause of the exception to better understand the failure and make appropriate decisions.

trans-unit.source: Each language projection supports a method to access this more detailed information.
trans-unit.target: Each language projection supports a method to access this more detailed information.

trans-unit.source: An exception projects as an **HRESULT** value in Universal Windows apps.
trans-unit.target: An exception projects as an **HRESULT** value in Universal Windows apps.

trans-unit.source: The *Winerror.h* include file contains a very large list of possible **HRESULT** values that includes network errors.
trans-unit.target: The *Winerror.h* include file contains a very large list of possible **HRESULT** values that includes network errors.

trans-unit.source: The networking APIs support different methods for retrieving this detailed information on the cause of an exception.
trans-unit.target: The networking APIs support different methods for retrieving this detailed information on the cause of an exception.

trans-unit.source: Some APIs provide a helper method that converts the **HRESULT** value from the exception to an enumeration value.
trans-unit.target: Some APIs provide a helper method that converts the **HRESULT** value from the exception to an enumeration value.

trans-unit.source: Other APIs provide a method to retrieve the actual **HRESULT** value.
trans-unit.target: Other APIs provide a method to retrieve the actual **HRESULT** value.
